title: Not Your Place to force "Learning experiences" or "Challenges" on your team in ranked.

replies.body:
I have not played this game for a very long time, but I have learnt one thing, vision is underrated by so many.

I looked at a few of your match histories, and it looks like you don't buy a support vision item, and your vision scores are the usually the lowest on your team.  
If want to survive bottom lane, you need to ward and keep vison up as best you can to help prevent those ganks.

If you don't believe me, check out this image.

https://imgur.com/a/W1vHQ

We were repeatedly pushed up under our own tower. We would ping jungle for help, and the only answer we would get is "Soon". So they could take us down under tower. No help from Warwick. We ping and ping for help. But this wasnt about me, this was about the warwick who felt it was his decision to issue a "learning experience" to his team. 
One of those players who does not wish to play WITH the team, only talk down to them and issue their "decrees"
and apparently us getting our asses kicked and losing 6v23 was a "defeatist attitude" and "never play again"
You should not be dependent on your jungler to win lane. That is not his problem or job.

No but there is a difference between depending on jungler, and asking for assistance when you have the enemy pushing and killing you under your own towers. I look at it this way. Jungler is NOT there to play your lane for you, But Jungler is there to help get the BOOT OFF YOUR NECK so you can pick yourself up and mount a comeback. 

We had No breathing room at all, no moment to gather thoughts. And anytime we pinged for help, the only response we got was "soon"
and then when bot lane is lost (because we got NO ganks at all as they were pushing our lane back into base. It suddenly becomes a "learning experience", a "challenge" that WW decided to Force upon his team. 

But by that logic you post, by the other person below as well. If thats truly what it should be. Then Adc shouldnt rely on support. Top lane shouldnt rely on anyone. Support should be dumping all support items. And as I stated: Season 8 truly becomes the "Every player for themselves" season...
I will make sure to take you up on your advice :) sure hope adc can survive without shields/heals

How is this an effective reply to him saying you don't buy vision when you play support?  Or that you have the lowest vision score on your team across multiple games?

Focus on what you can do to improve, not what your jungler did in one game you played.

So if you have a bot lane where you are getting stomped under your tower. According to you, We shouldnt ask Jungler for help? Then why the hell even have a jungler to begin with. I KNOW that jungle's role isnt to play the lane for you. But if you got a boot on your neck by the enemy team, your logic is "sit there and learn how to get the boot off your neck yourself, dont bother asking your jungler for any assistance"

So By your own logic, I dont have to support my adc, they just just learn how to heal and CC the enemy themselves and learn how to 1v2 properly. 
And yeah, so I dont ward as often, because I watch movement patterns from wards that are out, often all I need is the trinket. I play from the mini map, I know how to watch movement patterns. 

Dont worry, I will take your advice and stop healing my adcs, telling them "hay you should focus on what you can do to heal yourself, dont rely on support to help you"
Because that IS your logic

> According to you, We shouldnt ask Jungler for help?

I said nothing of the sort.

> So By your own logic, I dont have to support my adc

I said nothing of the sort.

> Dont worry, I will take your advice and stop healing my adcs, telling them "hay you should focus on what you can do to heal yourself, dont rely on support to help you"

All I said is you need to focus less on what your team is doing wrong and focus on what you can do to improve as a player.  I also made a comment on the quality if your reply to Warios, seeing as how you put words in his mouth as well and argued against not what he actually said, but what you wanted him to say.

If you actually want to discuss the worst move you can make is putting words into someone else's mouth.

Im going to tell you guys the truth fuck leagues team game mentality people have that is bullshit. The best way to win games is to play for yourself that is how smurfs do it to win games you know why? Because there is no good players you should rely on in any single elo even challenger. Best way to win stomp lane stomp game how do you think TF BLADE is rank 1 and 2 he plays akali a champion that stomps lane and snowballs.

I have discovered that sad truth myself. As much as I TRY to think of this as a team game. There is no getting past that Riot just needs to Burn the summoners code. It is outdated, ignored. laughed at. Thought of as a joke. People are more concerned with how great they look solo and are happy to screw over the team for PERSONAL greed. As a support I have tried to get teamplay going when I see it, but more and more I am learning the only way to get anything done is to just let the team die and focus on yourself. I tried being a team player, apparently I was fooling myself. 
People are too greedy, self centered and wrapped up in how "Totally OP" they are. Sometimes goals intersect, but I am seeing the best way to win is to look at your team as disposable. Riot Even seems to push this idea with the whole "Solo Carry" notion. Where One player is ABOVE the rest, and everyone on the team thinks they are THAT player. SO they sit there and talk down to thier teammates, look down thier nose at thier "Trash team". 

I changed my goal, started going jax support, and started winning lane by ignoring my adc who often (rather than actually trying to win) is more concerned with throwing the biggest and loudest in-lane tantrum possible. 
(I had a lucian who threw a complete fit and abandoned lane because I, as support, had a whole...whopping...amazing......... 3 CS!. Yep he ditched his lane and ran mid because I had 3 minion kills) 
They will kick and scream and swear, call me a troll and tell people to "/all report the troll" while the ignore minions and completely stop playing the game entirely because they cant control everyone and everything in the match. 
So yeah, I am playing more solo, building my own builds. Playing my own strategies. WInning my own way, playing my own champs. 

I repeat: Burn the summoners code, its done its work, Now its just a relic laughed at by the new season of players and those who have played long enough to see the truth.

If you've died 15 times in bot lane, a gank isn't gonna help. Your jungler may have been an asshole, and may have been wrong, but if you lose lane that badly, it's on you. For one reason or another, you can't count on the jungler to win lane for you. 

Looking through your match history, I strongly suggest reading some guides on the champs you play. You seem to have wildly different builds in each game, and while improvisation in the face of different challenges is good, virtually all champs and roles have "core" item paths you'll want to follow. Doran's Ring is bad on supports, since the main point of the item is the mana return from killing creeps. Similarly, Relic Shield and its build path generally aren't used on ranged supports. And as others in this thread have said, ward use is among the most distinguishing factor in how good a support is.
Well did you learn anything?

I learned that jungler is a free role.  You dont have to do anything according to this community. Why actually help lanes, I mean its not junglers job to provide ganks or help lanes that are being pressured. Good to know these are the rules for Season 8
League has truly become "Every player for themselves"
Good job riot, enjoy your solo carry failures

You talk about "every player for themselves", and looking at your build paths, that's what you are trying to do yourself.  You have Karma games with berserker's greaves , very few games playing Soraka with Ardent or a vision item.

Sure it is a team game of 5, but the only thing you have control over for your team, is what you can do yourself to make the game a success for your team,  the stronger you can make your champion for the role you are in, the more success you will have over all.  Need to strive to make yourself experienced enough to offset the weaker players in other roles, to have the best chance to get a win.

HavokDash, take a look at this website, https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/silver/champion/Karma/Support/ , see what people use for their builds,  not saying everything is the right thing when you read this information, but you can see what others are using to have sucess and incorperate it into your play style.

u need to have enough skill to at least hold while under the turret and delay long enough for your jungler to clear his creeps then come in to gank. He may also be occupied with counterjungling top or tracking the enemy jungler so he may not have the luxury to gank bot.

if you are getting killed under your turret then you deserve to lose. In fact, surviving under turret and losing CS is bad enough, you need to at least survive 2v3 under turret and have equal cs to enemy adc to win the ranked game and climb the ranked ladder.

Most likely I believe you pushed the lane when your jungler was on the other side of the map and their jungler ganked which ended up in bot lane getting wiped. Never a good idea

Okay so I am in low elo for norms and comp (because I have been only playing for a month and a half) and when I play jungle I will choose what I think is the right time to gank...sometimes its not the right time but it takes pressure off of that lane for a bit.  While your jungler could have done that its not their job to baby you. They need to farm and ward and help the other lanes. I will agree that you do need to learn how to hold your own they took it too far. However its not entirely their fault. Warding is your part as a support. If you dont take out enemy wards and or ward yourself so your jungle can sneek in and help you out that's not their fault its yours.  I will generally provide a good amount of vision for my top and mid and part of the bottom river. I expect the support to ward near their area. Because hell I main supports and that's what I do because I am closest and its my job to look after my adc (and myself) and warding is apart of that.  Its partly your fault that you got ganked. But its also your junglers fault if they are  not keeping the river warded and or keeping tabs on their jungler overall. 
I don't ask anymore out anyone than I would out of myself. 
Also what time I choose to gank should be up to me. I might feel I need more items or I might need to get my ult first if the enemy has a tanky support because if I go in I am more of a liability and I will hurt your lane more because not only will they now be higher in cs but now they will also have gold from my death. 
There is a cost benefit analysis when it comes to a gank. One wrong misstep can really fuck a lane over and or your team. 

Your jungler had a semi good point but his execution was terrible... leaving you high and dry was not a good idea but I don't think its what cost you the game.

Edit: My bad thought u was on red team so i had the kill map flipped lmao mb about that, but both you and lucians lane deaths both look like from pushing up with no vison whatsoever. then the lane deaths which nothing to really say about that
